result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:51 AM Defendant Antonio M Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Antonio M Smith. 9:27 AM Defendant Antonio M Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Antonio M Smith.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Antonio M Smith.  Attorney John M Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. The deft. is in HOC and refused to be transported.  This is unacceptable to this court.  BTC: State to prepare an OTT.  State to list to transport the defendant by whatever reasonable means necessary.  Atty Samuels has just gotten this case 2 days ago.  State has tendered an offer.  The defendant has informed atty Angove this should be set for trial.  Defense asks the court to have the deft. remain in RCJ the week of Sept. 20 to go over the offer.  BTC: Atty Samuels request is denied, atty Samuels to discuss the offer with the deft. before the Sept. 20 date given.

email sent to rpd at 3:48

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims T.L (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
